title: Patissiers, Paris

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of platinum-palladium print.

inscriptions: Inscribed verso: “P1216 [in a circle]”; inscribed verso: “PATISSIERS, PARIS 1950”; inscribed verso: “30/35 [in a circle]”; inscribed verso: “Platinum-palladium / print made July 1976”; signed and stamped verso: “Irving Penn / Hand-coated by the photographer [in a circle]”; stamped and inscribed verso: “PHOTOGRAPH BY IRVING PENN / Copyright © 1951 by / LES EDITIONS CONDE NAST SA / Not to be reproduced without / written permission of the / copyright owner.”; stamped and inscribed verso: “In addition to 30 prints of this / image in platinum metals, unnumbered, but signed, silver / prints not exceeding a total of 6 may exist. / I.P.”
credit_line: Purchased with funds provided by Mrs. Leigh B. Block
publication_history:
Penn, Irving. 1960. “Moments Preserved.” Simon and Schuster. p. 177. (other print of this image)

Penn, Irving. 1974. “Worlds in a Small Room.” Grossman Publishers. p. 13. (other print of this image/variant showing full negative including edge of seam)

Galleria Civica d’Arte Moderna, Turin. 1975. “I platini di Irving Penn: 25 anni di fotografia.” Exh. cat. Galleria Civica d’Arte Moderna/Ages Arti Grafiche. p. 25. (other print of this image)

Marlborough Gallery, New York. 1977. “Irving Penn: Photographs in Platinum Metals, Images 1947–1975.” Exh. cat. Marlborough Gallery. n.pag., cat. 59. (other print of this image)

Foresta, Merry A. and William F. Stapp. 1990. “Irving Penn: Master Images.” Exh. cat. National Museum of American Art and National Portrait Gallery/Smithsonian Institution Press. p. 32, cat. 19. (other print of this image)

Penn, Irving. 1991. "Passage: A Work Record." Knopf. p. 90. (other print of this image)

Lundström, Jan-Erik. 1995. “Irving Penn fotografier: en donation till mine av Lisa Fonssagrives-Penn/Irving Penn Photographs: A Donation in Memory of Lisa Fonssagrives-Penn.” Exh. cat. Moderna Museet/Raster Förlag. p. 199. (other print of this image)

Westerbeck, Colin. 1997. “Irving Penn: A Career in Photography.” Exh. cat. Art Institute of Chicago/Bulfinch Press. p. 34, cat. 71, pl. 10 and back cover.

Heckert, Virginia and Anne Lacoste. 2009. “Irving Penn: Small Trades.” Exh. cat. J. Paul Getty Museum/Getty Publications. pl. 13. (other print of this image)
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, “Irving Penn, A Career in Photography,” November 22, 1997–February 1, 1998; traveled to St. Petersburg, Russia, State Hermitage Museum, March 1–May 16, 1998; Hamburg, Germany, Deichtorhallen, June 18–September 6, 1998; Munich, Germany, Müchner Stadtmuseum, October 6, 1998–February 21, 1999; San Francisco, California, Friends of Photography/Ansel Adams Center for Photography, November 11, 1999–January 23, 2000; Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, March 25–June 4, 2000; Paris, France, Maison Européenne de la Photographie, September 13–November 5, 2000. (Colin Westerbeck)

Art Institute of Chicago, “Irving Penn: A Tribute,” October 31–December 13, 2009. (Matthew S. Witkovsky)

Art Institute of Chicago, “In the Vernacular,” February 6–May 31, 2010. (Greg Harris)
provenance_text: Marlborough Gallery, New York [then the artist's representative], by September 1977; sold to the Art Institute, 1977.
copyright_notice: Copyright Les Editions Condé Nast S.A.
